group_1.textRight: ...You're going to be the East's mediator?
But you haven't been a Magical Girl for very long,@have you...?

group_1.textLeft: Mhm. My experience as a Magical Girl@is rather limited.
I've also never been a leader until now.
Nobody else was stepping up to the plate, though.
If we need someone to fill the role,@then I can handle it.
You said you're not here to find the culprit, right?
Then what are you here for?@What do you want to negotiate?

group_1.textRight: ...I'd like to make an agreement that, starting now,
Eastern Magical Girls will no longer hunt Witches@in Western territory without permission.

group_1.textLeft: Is that your way of saying that we should stick to@protecting our own territories?
Then I trust that your side will respect our territory@as well?

group_1.textRight: despite the fact that a Magical Girl from the East@is the one who caused this problem.

group_1.textLeft: I apologize for what happened.@Naturally, I'll make amends.
But don't try to play dumb and pretend that@Magical Girls from the West...
...haven't been invading the East themselves.
I don't agree with using the past as a shield@to decide how things go from here on out.
Now that I'm their leader,
it's my duty to protect the futures@of the East's Magical Girls.

group_1.textRight: ...I guess you didn't just step forward@as a spur-of-the-moment thing.

group_1.textLeft: Of course not.
Mm. I have no objections to that.

group_1.textRight: ...And this might be out of line, but...
If you're going to call yourself a leader, you're going@to have to shoulder a lot of responsibility.

group_1.narration: "At the time, I remember thinking,@'Isn't that obvious...?'@...But I soon came to understand firsthand@what Nanami was trying to say."

group_1.textLeft: ...Is this everyone you could round up?
I thought I'd told you that we were having@a meeting...
...to discuss how we can come together and@cooperate as Magical Girls from the East...

group_1.textRight: ...I'm here because you helped me out earlier.
Everyone else, though... How do I put this...@They probably feel like...
...this is a huge hassle to force on them@for something that'll only tide us over...

group_1.narration: "The only two people@who acknowledged me as the boss of the East@and were willing to work together@were the same girls@who had caused the territorial spat."
"But there was another issue that bothered me@more than the lack of cooperation."
"Some saw me as@an impertinent greenhorn for taking charge...@Essentially, those veteran Magical Girls@tried to harass me by provoking the West."

group_1.textLeft: You're wounded...

group_1.textRight: More importantly, the veteran girls are messing@with the West again...!

group_1.textLeft: It's not your fault... The blame falls to me@for arriving too late.
(...A final warning from Nanami...)
(It seems I can no longer be particular about@my methods.)

group_1.textCenter: Ripping up the West's territory, are you?

group_1.textLeft: You were unwilling to accept responsibility earlier,@you rat.
Nor did you stop me when I came forward@as leader.
You've made your bed; now lie in it.
[chara:770700:effect_7000_attack01][surround:1016A01]Hmph!
If you don't care for the way I run things,
then defeat me and take the reins for yourself.

group_1.narration: "Rather than use diplomacy to persuade others,@my approach back then was domination@through sheer displays of power,@in order to leave no room@for the West to take advantage of me."

group_1.textRight: Kanagi! We've got some Eastern girls quarreling@in the shopping district!

group_1.textLeft: I'll be right there.

group_1.narration: "As I demonstrated what I was capable of,@I was no longer ridiculed@for my lack of experience.@I became recognized as the leader of the East..."
"But my methods did not bring@the Magical Girls of the East@peace of mind."
"In the truest sense...@I was unable to protect them@in the way that I wanted to."
